questions.question_text:
A social media company wants to change encryption ciphers after identifying weaknesses in the implementation of the existing ciphers. The company needs the new ciphers to meet the following requirements:

• Utilize less RAM than competing ciphers.
• Be more CPU-efficient than previous ciphers.
• Require customers to use TLS 1.3 while broadcasting video or audio.

Which of the following is the best choice for the social media company?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
 ChaCha20-Poly1305 is known for its efficiency in software implementations, especially on devices without hardware acceleration, making it more CPU-efficient than AES-GCM
 It generally uses less RAM compared to other ciphers
 It is supported by TLS 1.3, ensuring secure and efficient encryption for broadcasting video or audio

Selected Answer: C
ChaCha20-Poly1305 is highly efficient on CPUs that lack hardware acceleration for AES (Advanced Encryption Standard). Unlike AES-GCM, which relies heavily on hardware optimizations (like AES-NI instructions) for peak performance, ChaCha20-Poly1305 maintains high performance across a broader range of hardware, including mobile devices and embedded systems.
ChaCha20-Poly1305 is fully supported in TLS 1.3, ensuring that customers can use it seamlessly for secure communications during video or audio broadcasts. TLS 1.3 prioritizes modern, secure cipher suites, and ChaCha20-Poly1305 aligns well with its security enhancements.

B. AES-GCM - Requires Hardware acceleration, if you dont want to sacrafice speed. supported by TLS 1.3
*C. ChaCha20-Poly1305 - The fastest and supported by TLS 1.3 "THE RIGHT ANSWER"

choices.B: Enable input validation for all fields.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
This is the way

Selected Answer: AB
A. Configure firewall rules to block all external traffic.
Since the security policy mandates that only internal users should have access to the application, configuring firewall rules to block all external (public) traffic ensures that unauthorized external entities cannot access the application. This is a direct and immediate way to enforce the access policy, reducing the attack surface by limiting exposure to only trusted internal networks.
B. Enable input validation for all fields.
Buffer overflows often exploit insufficient input validation, allowing attackers to send malicious input that can overwrite memory. By enforcing strict input validation, the application can ensure that only properly formatted and expected data is processed, thereby preventing buffer overflow attacks.

Ans AB.
A. Configure firewall rules to block all external traffic.
B. Enable input validation for all fields.
Configuring firewall rules will prevent external access to the application and enabling input validation helps protect against buffer overflow vulnerabilities by ensuring that only properly formatted data is accepted.

questions.question_text: A security engineer is assessing a new tool to segment data and communications between domains. The assessment must determine how data transmission controls can be bypassed without detection. Which of the following techniques should the security engineer use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A covert channel is an unintended or unauthorized communication path that can be used to transfer information in a manner that violates the system's security policy. Covert channels are specifically about bypassing data transmission controls without detection, aligning perfectly with the engineer's goal. covert channels can be used to exfiltrate or transfer data across these boundaries. overt channels are designed to be difficult to detect, as they use non-obvious methods for data transmission, such as manipulating system resources or timing.

Ans. C. Covert channel analysis
Covert channel analysis focuses on identifying methods by which information can be transferred in ways that are not intended by the design of the system, making it suitable for this assessment.
